intro: Nanothamnus, commonly known as the coastal thornbush, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Rutaceae. These shrubs are native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. They are characterized by their small, thorny stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The flowers are typically small and yellow, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. Nanothamnus species are well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in harsh coastal environments with high salt exposure.
